definition: lit. one hair from nine oxen (idiom)/fig. a drop in the ocean
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])

sentences.english: The sums involved were small beer for a behemoth like GE.
sentences.chinese: 涉及金額對財大氣粗的通用來說不過是九牛一毛。

sentences.english: Well, my knowledge in the field is but a drop in the bucket.
sentences.chinese: 唉，我那點知識不過是本學科的九牛一毛而已。

sentences.english: And that’s only a tiny slice of the bits that flew around the Internet last year.
sentences.chinese: 而且這不過是去年整個互聯網上流量的九牛一毛罷了。

sentences.english: Mr Abid said the training his company is doing is "just a drop in the ocean".
sentences.chinese: Abid先生說他公司進行的培訓只是“九牛一毛。”

sentences.english: More than one thousand yuan. Manager Li treated us.
sentences.chinese: 對李經理來說，這點錢只是九牛一毛。

sentences.english: The new tax cuts are a drop in the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 新減稅額只是九牛一毛。

definition: lit. minor magician in the presence of a great one (idiom)/fig. to pale into insignificance by comparison
lit. a cup of water on a burning cart of firewood (idiom); fig. an utterly inadequate measure
a small appetizer/a piece of cake; very easy (idiom)
pediatrics/pediatric (department)/sth of little importance/trifle/a child's play/(slang) childish/petty/stingy
a tiny bit/very little/next to nothing (idiom)
